one: ^What brings you to our village? I want to believe that you do not want any trouble.
^(Nolwazi takes a deep breath and reaches into her bag, retrieving the papyrus with the image of Edrice and Ahmed.)
^I've been sent on a quest by my grandmother to find the Saqqara Tombs.
^This papyrus is the only clue I have. I wonder if you can help me.
^That papyrus... how on earth did you get it? It’s linked to our family tree.
^Come with me to the house with two large potted cacti.
two: ^Safiya leads Nolwazi to an old, weathered house. Inside, they find Edrice, the village elder, surrounded by historical artifacts.
^(Edrice looks up from her work as Safiya and Nolwazi enter.)
^Mama, this traveller seeks the Saqqara Tombs. She has something that might peak your interest.
^(Edrice regards Nolwazi with a knowing look.)
^(nodding) Let me see. Oh dear child, I knew your dearest grandmother, she was an amazing woman.
^However, I cannot help you, I do not have all the pieces to the puzzle you seek to solve.
^That necklace you see on the papyrus; it was a gift from my first love Ahmed. You see, it was stolen from me by my snake of a neighbour Femi.
^You will need to retrieve it, but be careful and do not trust her.
^She has been wanting to bargain that necklace off for years but has never done so because she understands the value that necklace holds to her and I.
^Treat her with respect, when greeting her say "as-salamu alaykum", it means peace be with you.
^She will be more open to you, when you greet her with respect.
^Thank you Edrice. I will go to her.
